commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I'm back, and I've gathered a whole bunch of signatures!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Welcome back, Kasumi! What were everyone's reactions like?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Everyone was so positive! Some girls even called out to me while I was heading back because they wanted to add their signatures!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Sounds like Mari did the perfect job of reeling everyone in.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: *Chuckle* Totally. I had girls from different classes telling me the event sounded like fun and that we had their support.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I had comments and offers coming outta my ears!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Comments and offers coming out of your ears? Rina-chan Board says, "Question mark?"

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: People were saying things like, "It's a place where everyone's dreams can come true, right? Then I wanna help out behind-the-scenes, too!"

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: The girls in the life design course said they'd help make the costumes.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Everyone in the international exchange course offered their assistance to show any international visitors around.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It feels as though we have the support of the whole school.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It's not just a feeling, Setsuna. I figured I needed to do some footwork for the other clubs, but when I got to them they all offered to help however they could.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Everyone's grateful to you for acting as the mediator between the student council and each club for the school tour thing.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: You really did make a lot of rounds.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Good deeds done are good deeds earned! Wonderful!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You made the right choice in helping Shioko!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: We're going to get so many signatures that Shioriko's eyes will pop out.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I'm starting to think we can pull this off!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Don't think it, do it. We're not gonna let all of our hard work up until now go to waste.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I can't think of holding the event anywhere but at Nijigasaki now.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, before I forget! There's something else we need to do other than gather signatures, so I called in some reinforcements.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Huh? Reinforcements?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Yoohoo! We're here!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thanks for coming! Hm? Only the three of you today?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Yes, the others are busy doing other things so it's only us today.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: So what was with all the excitement just now? Something happen?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Well, actually...

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: That really happened? I guess that's Mari for you! She sure knows how to make a scene!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I'm glad you're getting a good number of signatures!

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Sorry for leaving all of you to handle the venue preparations on your own.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's totally okay. It's the least we could do after causing everyone so much trouble ourselves.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So anyway, I want your opinions about what we're going to do and where, if the event is held at Nijigasaki. Once that's done I can go and present it all to Shioriko.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Leave that all to us! Let's go and explore Nijigasaki! I wonder what we'll find?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Honoka, we have not come here for fun and games.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Let us study the school layout and its facilities. Could you please show us around?

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Is it okay for us to take photos around the school so we can report back to Aqours?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Of course you can. Let's get going, then.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Yup! We're in your hands!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Phew... Nijigasaki sure is big.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Honestly, it far exceeded my expectations.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: There were so many special classrooms and the cafeteria food looked amazing! I wish we had that at our school!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I'd end up living in the cafeteria if we had food that amazing!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Uh-huh! I don't think we'd ever stop chatting!

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Goodness me... I can completely imagine them engrossed in their cafeteria food.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Laugh* Anyway, let's get right into it. What do you three think about stage set-up and stuff?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I think the auditorium should be the main stage and then we could probably set up two sub-stages...

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Yeah, that sounds good. How about we also give a theme to each of the stages while we're at it?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: It might be a good idea to create spaces for everyone to mingle, since we will have school idols from all around the country joining the event.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Then should we divvy up spaces for each school idol or group and have them do their own thing?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: H-Hold up! Let me write all of this down!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You three sure are amazing. Ideas just keep popping out of you.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Um, while we are at it, could I also touch on the topic of facilities for the visitors?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yes, please.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: First, restrooms. Finding them is difficult in unfamiliar places, so let's set up some large signs. We also need to address the stairs as they will be dangerous with crowds.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I see...

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: It'd be nice to have a map to carry around with you since Nijigasaki's so huge. Putting up large guide maps would be great, too.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: That huge notice board in the school that all the students were looking at! Could we post the schedules for the day up onto them?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Probably. We could use the digital notice boards, too.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Ooh, that's an awesome idea!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I love how we can see it coming together now. We really should've had everyone come with us.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Yes, indeed. We will report everything from today at our next regular meeting and gather everyone's feedback there.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'll make sure to have everything put together properly by then!
